newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London struggle for direction.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London struggle for direction.

text.p: Japanese shares were little changed in thin European trade on Monday due to a scarcity of fresh news, dealers said.
"It's very dead. We've only seen a few shares trade and even then in low volumes," one dealer said.
"This is the quietest day I've seen so far this year."
On Monday in Tokyo, shares sprinted higher with the Nikkei 225 index closing 383.04 points or 1.91 percent firmer to 20,451.85.
Fujitsu was the most active issue by 1330 GMT, trading at 1,442.5 yen versus a Tokyo close of 1,450 yen.
